metadata.title: USN-6510-1 -- Apache HTTP Server vulnerability
metadata.description: David Shoon discovered that the Apache HTTP Server mod_macro module incorrectly handled certain memory operations. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause the server to crash, resulting in a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6510-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm11 apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm11 apache2-dev - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm11 apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm11 apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm11 apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm11 apache2-doc - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm11 apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm11 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
